page.title: 13Bangor Cathedral
page.content: {St.Deiniol}founded the{cathedral}in 546. Twenty years earlier{St. Deiniol founded a monastry on the same site. The first settlement there had a fence round it called a bangor ,'a wattle fence'.The{cathedral}was inland from the sea for protection from raiders in boats. Some parts of the{cathedral}date back to the 11th century,most to the 13th and 14th centuries.{Gilbert Scott rebuilt the whole{cathedral}in 1868-1884. Some interesting things include some 10th century crosses.Also there are some dog tongs used for catching dogs if they got into services.{Gilbert {Scott}planned to build a big central tower but the foundations would not take it, so the tower is short and stubby.The{Bishop's throne}is modelled on{St.Augustine's Chair}at Canterbury.
